GET /zones/{zone_identifier}/firewall/wa.description:
Fetches WAF packages for a zone.

**Note:** Applies only to the [previous version of WAF managed rules](https://developers.cloudflare.com/support/firewall/managed-rules-web-application-firewall-waf/understanding-waf-managed-rules-web-application-firewall/).

schema.description: The page number of paginated results.
The number of packages per page.
The field used to sort returned packages.
The direction used to sort returned packages.
When set to `all`, all the search requirements must match. When set to `any`, only one of the search requirements has to match.
The name of the WAF package.

success.description: Whether the API call was successful

count.description: Total number of results for the requested service

page.description: Current page within paginated list of results

per_page.description: Number of results per page of results

total_count.description: Total results available without any search parameters

description.description: A summary of the purpose/function of the WAF package.

detection_mode.description: The mode that defines how rules within the package are evaluated during the course of a request. When a package uses anomaly detection mode (`anomaly` value), each rule is given a score when triggered. If the total score of all triggered rules exceeds the sensitivity defined in the WAF package, the action configured in the package will be performed. Traditional detection mode (`traditional` value) will decide the action to take when it is triggered by the request. If multiple rules are triggered, the action providing the highest protection will be applied (for example, a 'block' action will win over a 'challenge' action).

name.description: The name of the WAF package.

status.description: When set to `active`, indicates that the WAF package will be applied to the zone.

description.description: A summary of the purpose/function of the WAF package.

Traditional detection mode (`traditional` value) will decide the action to take when it is triggered by the request. If multiple rules are triggered, the action providing the highest protection will be applied (for example, a 'block' action will win over a 'challenge' action).

name.description: The name of the WAF package.

status.description: When set to `active`, indicates that the WAF package will be applied to the zone.

action_mode.description: The default action performed by the rules in the WAF package.

description.description: A summary of the purpose/function of the WAF package.
description.example: Covers OWASP Top 10 vulnerabilities and more.

sensitivity.description: The sensitivity of the WAF package.

GET /zones/{zone_identifier}/firewall/wa.description:
Fetches the details of a WAF package.

**Note:** Applies only to the [previous version of WAF managed rules](https://developers.cloudflare.com/support/firewall/managed-rules-web-application-firewall-waf/understanding-waf-managed-rules-web-application-firewall/).

success.description: Whether the API call was successful
Whether the API call was successful
Whether the API call was successful

4XX.description: Get a WAF package response failure

PATCH /zones/{zone_identifier}/firewall/.description:
Updates a WAF package. You can update the sensitivity and the action of an anomaly detection WAF package.

**Note:** Applies only to the [previous version of WAF managed rules](https://developers.cloudflare.com/support/firewall/managed-rules-web-application-firewall-waf/understanding-waf-managed-rules-web-application-firewall/).

action_mode.description: The default action performed by the rules in the WAF package.

sensitivity.description: The sensitivity of the WAF package.

success.description: Whether the API call was successful

description.description: A summary of the purpose/function of the WAF package.

When a package uses anomaly detection mode (`anomaly` value), each rule is given a score when triggered. If the total score of all triggered rules exceeds the sensitivity defined in the WAF package, the action configured in the package will be performed. Traditional detection mode (`traditional` value) will decide the action to take when it is triggered by the request. If multiple rules are triggered, the action providing the highest protection will be applied (for example, a 'block' action will win over a 'challenge' action).
